ovdesc.p: This ‘H’ type table defines the structure of file headers used by the different PE-ACH to contain the XML UNIFI messages SEPA received and sent.
The key of the SEPA.HEADER table consists in the key of the corresponding UNIFI.XML.TAG and UNIFI.XML.MESSAGE.
Per example for the credit transfer processed through PE-ACH STEP2 we have:
SCTIcfBlkCredTrf Credit Transfer Bulk message issuing (Issuing Bank to PE-ACH)
SCTCvfBlkCredTrf Credit Transfer Bulk acknowledgment (PE-ACH to Issuing Bank)
SCTScfBlkCredTrf Credit Transfer Bulk sending (PE-ACH to Receiving Bank)
SCTCcfBlkCredTrf Credit Transfer Bulk settlement confirmation (to Issuing Bank)

The file header XML formatting and mapping is done here after. The correspondence with the destination T24 application fields in inward and the mapping from the generating T24 application in outward is also done on this application. For both inward and outward processing, the elements mapped in the file header through this application are merged with the ones mapped from the group header, original group and transaction information as defined in SEPA.LAYOUT.

desc.p: This Field specifies the Direction of file ‘INWARD’ or ‘OUTWARD’
Mandatory field and Multi Value set
This Field specifies the Routine used to fil in the first tag of file header
This Field specifies the Routine allowing a post treatment for a XML outward message: additional record in COMI or non production of the file (ETEXT <> ‘’).
This Field specifies the Routine adding a pre header text record to an outward message (passed as COMI variable).
This Field specifies the Prefix used for header tags (e.g.: S2SCTCcf:)
This field denotes the Content of the file type header field (e.g.: CCF)
This field specified the Additional characters set on a message Id:
Associated Multi Value set of the field FILE.DIRECTION
This field defines the Prefix in use for message tags (e.g. sw2:)
Associated Multi Value set of the field FILE.DIRECTION
This Field is defaulted with the Override message generated for this application.
This field contains the Peach Id in SEPA.PEACH
Value upto 10 and must exist in SEPA.PEACH application
This Field contains All UNIFI.XML.MESSAGE allowed for the header
Mandatory field and Associated Multi Value set of field FILE.DIRECTION
Value should exist in UNIFI.XML.MESSAGE application
This Field Defines whether the peach reject is allowed or not based on file type such as CVF, DVF and other types allowed for SEPA
Value upto 3 Characters and user can input only 'YES' or 'NO'
This Field holds the Key to UNIFI.XML.MESSAGE & UNIFI.XML.TAG
Value upto 35 type A(Alphanumeric) and value must exist in UNIFI.XML.MESSAGE Application
This field contains the Short description for enrichment.
This fields holds the Key to SEPA.FIELDS used to:
'Set' the inward original or modified content into SEPA.INWARD.FILES.
'Set' the outward original or modified content into SEPA.OUTWARD.FILES.
'Retrieve' the outward tag element mapping from a T24 application.
'Calculate' or 'default' the content of any tag.
Associated Multi Value Subset of field FIELD.TAG.ID
Value should exist in SEPA.FIELDS application

This field is Associated with one or more (with “,” as separator) MAP.FIELDS defined in SEPA.PARAMETER to the retrieved or extracted element. (e.g.: FILE2 for 2nd element of the SEPA.INWARD.FILES and SEPA.OUTWARD.FILES key or TNEW1,MNEW1 for 1st element of new transaction Id and 1st element of new message Id.
Associated Multi Value set of field FIELD.TAG.ID
This fields holds the Key to corresponding UNIFI.XML.FORMAT.
Associated Multi Value set of field FIELD.TAG.ID
Value should exist in UNIFI.XML.FORMAT application
This field contains the Short name for that element used as enrichment for a related log message.
Associated Multi Value set of field FIELD.TAG.ID
This field contains the Unique identification of alternative tags.
Associated Multi Value set of field FIELD.TAG.ID
Unique identification of a basic tag as defined in the given UNIFI.XML.MESSAGE record.
This field holds the Number of occurrences for that TAG.
n.M : Occurs at least M times
N.0 : Up to N occurrences or none.
N.M : Occurs between M and N times.
Associated Multi Value set of field FIELD.TAG.ID
This field contains the File Header Validation Routine for inward files. The routine will be called after all File Header Tags were read.
This field contains header load routine which returns the message nature.
